      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Used by subclass predicate interpreters ("e_*()" and "a_*()" methods) to give access to the currently being read predicate through the currentPredicate() method.

    • Field Detail

      • currentPred

        private Predicate currentPred
        Used by subclass predicate interpreters ("e_*()" and "a_*()" methods) to give access to the currently being read predicate through the currentPredicate() method. Mostly for error reporting.

      • lineNumber

        private int lineNumber
        Global to keep track of line numbers when reading files for error reporting.

      • h_read

        public static java.lang.String h_read
        the help string for the a_read(String) predicate interpreter.

      • h_help

        public static java.lang.String h_help
        the help string for the a_help(String) predicate interpreter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PredicateReader

        public PredicateReader(java.lang.String name)
        Constructor thad does nothing except for recording this PredicateReader's name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this PredicateReading

      • PredicateReader

        public PredicateReader(PredicateReader p)
        Copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        p - a PredicateReader to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • fromFile

        public int fromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Read predicates from file fileName, one per line. Note the line may contain comments ("//" to end of line). Calls fromStream(BufferedReader).
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file to open and read.
        Returns:
        the number of lines read from the file, -1 if something went wrong.

      • fromStream

        public int fromStream(java.io.BufferedReader stream)
        Read predicates from file stream, one per line. Note the line may contain comments ("//" to end of line). Calls assert_(String) once per line.
        Parameters:
        stream -
        Returns:
        the number of lines read from the file, -1 if something when wrong

      • formatLineNumber

        private java.lang.String formatLineNumber()
        If lineNumber is 0, returns the empty string, otherwise returns "on line : ". Used to display error output.
        Returns:
        an appropriate String.

      • makePredicate

        private Predicate makePredicate(java.lang.String line)
        Creates a predicate based on the text in line. That is, strips comments and calls the string Predicate constructor.
        Parameters:
        line - the text line to make a Predicate out of.
        Returns:
        a Predicate or null, depending on if there is a predicate in line.

      • assert_

        public void assert_(java.lang.String line)
        Attempts to assert a predicate, created from line using makePredicate(String). If the line is empty, just contains an comment, or the predicate is is malformed, not attempt is made to call assert_(Predicate).
        Parameters:
        line - the line to make a predicate from.

      • eval

        public boolean eval(java.lang.String line)
        Attempts to evaluate a predicate, created from line using makePredicate(String). If the line is empty, just contains an comment, or the predicate is is malformed, not attempt is made to call eval(Predicate), and false is returned.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to make a predicate from.
        Returns:
        false if there's problems (above) or there is no such predicate; the return value of the predicate interpreter method otherwise.

      • assert_

        public void assert_(Predicate pred)
        Attempts to assert the predicate by searching for and executing a method named "a_[PredicateName]" (where [PredicateName] is the name of the Predicate object pred) and that has a parameter type list that matches the predicate's parameter type list.
        Parameters:
        pred - a predicate object to assert.

      • eval

        public boolean eval(Predicate pred)
        Attempts to evalutate the predicate by searching for and executing a method named "a_[PredicateName]" (where [PredicateName] is the name of the Predicate object pred) and that has a parameter type list that matches the predicate's parameter type list.
        Parameters:
        pred - a predicate object to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the value returned by the method described above; false if something when wrong.

      • assert_or_eval

        private boolean assert_or_eval(boolean isAssert,
                     Predicate pred)
        Attempts to evalutate or assert the predicate by searching for and executing a method named "a_[PredicateName]" (where [PredicateName] is the name of the Predicate object pred) and that has a parameter type list that matches the predicate's parameter type list.
        Parameters:
        isAssert - true if this is to be interpreted as an assertion, false if it's to be treated as an evaluation.
        pred - a predicate object to assert or evaluate.
        Returns:
        the value returned by the method described above; false if something when wrong.

      • a_read

        public void a_read(java.lang.String filename)
        Predicate interpreter for predicate "read(filename)". Calls fromFile(String) to assert the predicates in the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the file to read

      • a_help

        public void a_help(java.lang.String s)
        Predicate interpreter for predicate "help()". Uses the reflect facility to find all the "a_*" and "e_*" methods in the class of this and list them to System.out. Also searches for corresponding "h_*" static strings as an embellished explanation of the predicates.
        Parameters:
        s - ignored.

      • stripComments

        protected java.lang.String stripComments(java.lang.String line)
        Strips comments from a string, eg: "small(x)//check" becomes "small(x)".
        Parameters:
        line - the line to strip
        Returns:
        the stripped line

      • checkTypes

        protected static java.lang.String checkTypes(Predicate pred,
                          Predicate.ParamType type)
        Checks a unary predicate for a type matching the type parameter.
        Parameters:
        pred - a predicate to check.
        type - the proposed type of parameter 1.
        Returns:
        true if pred is a unary predicate that matches the type.

      • checkTypes

        protected static java.lang.String checkTypes(Predicate pred,
                          Predicate.ParamType type1,
                          Predicate.ParamType type2)
        Checks a binary predicate for a type matching the type parameters.
        Parameters:
        pred - a predicate to check.
        type1 - the proposed type of parameter 1.
        type2 - the proposed type of parameter 2.
        Returns:
        true if pred is a binary predicate that matches the types.

      • checkTypes

        protected static java.lang.String checkTypes(Predicate pred,
                          Predicate.ParamType type1,
                          Predicate.ParamType type2,
                          Predicate.ParamType type3)
        Checks a trinary predicate for a type matching the type parameters.
        Parameters:
        pred - a predicate to check.
        type1 - the proposed type of parameter 1.
        type2 - the proposed type of parameter 2.
        type3 - the proposed type of parameter 3.
        Returns:
        true if pred is a trinary predicate that matches the types.

      • formatError

        public static java.lang.String formatError(Predicate p,
                           java.lang.String exp)
        Utility method to format and error message.
        Parameters:
        p - a Predicate to be used in formatting the message.
        exp - an explanation string to be used in formatting the message.
        Returns:
        the formatted error message.

      • error

        public static void error(java.lang.String msg)
        Utility method to format and channel error messages to System.out.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to write to System.out.

      • currentPredicate

        public final Predicate currentPredicate()
        Utility method to allow other classes to access the predicate being processed or just processed. Primarily for error reporting purposes.
        Returns:
        the current or last-processed predicate.

      • errorWithPredicate

        public void errorWithPredicate(java.lang.String msg)
        Utility method to format and channel error messages to System.out.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to write to System.out.
